ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Re: Genetic Programming
ygData.msgSnippet: Would it be accurate to say that TWEANs are a subset of the GP domain? e.g. each neuron is a node that applies a function, but there happens to be only one

Would it be accurate to say that TWEANs are a subset of the GP domain? 
e.g. each neuron is a node that applies a function, but there happens to 
be only one function (in most cases), whereas in GP there is a llibrary 
of different functions. If you gift your TWEAN with a range of 
activation functions then the lines between the two domains become even 
more blurred. From the posts so far I take it that GP's evolve tree 
structures, whereas neural nets tend to have, well,  interconnected 
networks of nodes. But are the two approaches really that different?

Colin.
